definitions.meaning: 未经允许拿走他人的财物
definitions.usage: 指偷窃行为，通常涉及秘密地拿走不属于自己的东西，带有非法的含义。常用于描述小规模的偷窃行为，如偷钱包、商店商品等。

examples.scene: 在一个拥挤的火车站，一个年轻人看到地上有一个钱包，趁没人注意，他偷偷捡起来放进自己的口袋。
examples.chineseIdea: 年轻人想不劳而获，悄悄拿走不属于自己的东西。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He couldn't resist the temptation and decided to @ @ from the lost wallet.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He couldn't resist the temptation and decided to 「steal money」 from the lost wallet.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他抵不住诱惑，决定从丢失的钱包里「偷钱」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：He take money from the wallet secretly. 纠正：He stole money from the wallet.

examples.scene: 在一场热闹的表演中，一个新演员凭借出色的表现吸引了所有观众的注意力，完全盖过了其他演员的风头。
examples.chineseIdea: 新演员的表现非常突出，让观众的目光都集中在自己身上。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The new actor was so impressive that he managed to @ @ @ at the performance.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The new actor was so impressive that he managed to 「steal the show」 at the performance.
examples.chineseTranslation: 这位新演员表现得太出色了，他在表演中「抢尽风头」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：He take all the attention. 纠正：He stole the show.

definitions.meaning: 偷偷地或快速地移动或获取
definitions.usage: 指以隐秘或快速的方式移动、看一眼或获取某物，通常不涉及非法行为，而是描述一种轻巧或不引人注意的动作。

examples.scene: 在一个安静的图书馆里，两个学生隔着书架偷偷对视，不想被其他人发现。
examples.chineseIdea: 学生想快速看对方一眼，但又不想引起注意。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: While pretending to read, she tried to @ @ @ at her friend across the room.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: While pretending to read, she tried to 「steal a glance」 at her friend across the room.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她假装读书时，试图「偷瞄一眼」对面的朋友。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：She secretly look at her friend. 纠正：She stole a glance at her friend.

examples.scene: 在一场忙碌的家庭聚会上，一对情侣趁着大家不注意，悄悄在角落里亲吻了一下。
examples.chineseIdea: 情侣想在不被发现的情况下，快速地表达亲密。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: When no one was looking, he leaned in to @ @ @ from his partner.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: When no one was looking, he leaned in to 「steal a kiss」 from his partner.
examples.chineseTranslation: 当没人注意时，他凑过去从伴侣那里「偷吻了一下」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：He give a kiss secretly. 纠正：He stole a kiss.
